ThreadPool Class Reference

The ThreadPool class provides a pool of threads that can be used to perform an arbitrary number of tasks. More...

Detailed Description

The ThreadPool class provides a pool of threads that can be used to perform an arbitrary number of tasks.

Author:
Frank Fock
Version:
3.5.19

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ThreadPool::ThreadPool (  int  size = 4  ) 
 

Create a ThreadPool with a given number of threads.

Parameters:
size the number of threads started for performing tasks. The default value is 4 threads.

ThreadPool::ThreadPool (  int  size,
int  stackSize
) 
 

Create a ThreadPool with a given number of threads and stack size.

Parameters:
size the number of threads started for performing tasks. The default value is 4 threads.
stackSize the stack size for each thread.

virtual ThreadPool::~ThreadPool (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor will wait for termination of all threads.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void ThreadPool::execute (  Runnable *   )  [virtual]
 

Execute a task.

The task will be deleted after call of its run() method.

Reimplemented in QueuedThreadPool.

virtual void ThreadPool::idle_notification (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Notifies the thread pool about an idle thread (synchronized).

Reimplemented in QueuedThreadPool.

boolean ThreadPool::is_idle (   ) 
 

Check whether the ThreadPool is idle or not.

Returns:
TRUE if non of the threads in the pool is currently executing any task.

unsigned int ThreadPool::size (   )  [inline]
 

Get the size of the thread pool.

Returns:
the number of threads in the pool.

int ThreadPool::stack_size (   )  [inline]
 

Get the stack size.

Returns:
the stack size of each thread in this thread pool.
